Divine Fullness.quote: Bhagavan means one who possesses six opulences in full: wealth, strength, fame, beauty, knowledge and renunciation. (Vishnu Purana 6.5.47)

Supreme Being.quote: The word bhagavan means the Supreme Personality who possesses all riches, all strength, all fame, all beauty, all knowledge and all renunciation. (Bhagavata Purana 1.3.28)

Divine Consciousness.quote: Bhagavan is the supreme consciousness, the source of all that exists. (Brahma Sutra 1.1.2)

Divine Energy.quote: Just as fire spreads its light and heat everywhere, similarly, Bhagavan expands Himself by His diverse energies. (Bhagavata Purana 3.28.40)

Divine Existence.quote: The Supreme exists within and without - animate and inanimate. (Bhagavad Gita 13.16)

Divine Form.quote: Though unborn and immutable, the Lord of all beings, by My own nature, I manifest through My Maya. (Bhagavad Gita 4.6)

Divine Nature.quote: The nature of Bhagavan is sat-chit-ananda - eternal existence, pure consciousness, and infinite bliss. (Brahma Samhita 5.1)

Divine Qualities.quote: The Supreme Personality possesses innumerable auspicious qualities, of which sixty-four are considered principal. (Bhakti Rasamrita Sindhu 2.1.1)

Divine Abode.quote: The supreme abode of Lord Vishnu, where the self-realized souls reside, is illuminated neither by sun nor moon. (Bhagavad Gita 15.6)

Divine Creation.quote: I am the source of all spiritual and material worlds. Everything emanates from Me. (Bhagavad Gita 10.8)

Divine Presence.quote: I am the Super-soul, situated within the heart of all living entities. (Bhagavad Gita 10.20)

Divine Grace.quote: Only by devotional service can one understand Me as I am. (Bhagavad Gita 18.55)

Divine Knowledge.quote: To those who are constantly devoted to serving Me with love, I give the understanding by which they can come to Me. (Bhagavad Gita 10.10)

Divine Power.quote: Know that all opulent, beautiful and glorious creations spring from but a spark of My splendor. (Bhagavad Gita 10.41)

Divine Protection.quote: Abandon all varieties of dharma and just surrender unto Me. I shall deliver you from all sinful reactions. (Bhagavad Gita 18.66)

Divine Relationship.quote: I am the father of this universe, the mother, the support and the grandsire. (Bhagavad Gita 9.17)

Divine Activities.quote: The transcendental pastimes of Bhagavan are eternal and full of supreme bliss. (Bhagavata Purana 10.33.36)

Divine Names.quote: The holy name of Bhagavan has all potencies and is non-different from Him. (Padma Purana)

Divine Glory.quote: Neither the hosts of demigods nor the great sages know My origin or opulences. (Bhagavad Gita 10.2)

Divine Manifestation.quote: Whenever and wherever there is a decline in dharma, I manifest Myself. (Bhagavad Gita 4.7)

Divine Love.quote: Pure love for Bhagavan is eternally established in the hearts of living entities. (Chaitanya Charitamrita, Madhya 22.107)

Divine Service.quote: Devotional service to Bhagavan is the only means to approach Him. (Bhagavata Purana 11.14.21)

Divine Vision.quote: One who sees Me everywhere and sees everything in Me is never separated from Me. (Bhagavad Gita 6.30)

Divine Time.quote: I am time, the great destroyer of the worlds. (Bhagavad Gita 11.32)

Divine Will.quote: By My will alone does nature bring forth all moving and unmoving beings. (Bhagavad Gita 9.10)

Divine Reality.quote: I am the basis of the impersonal Brahman, which is immortal, imperishable and eternal. (Bhagavad Gita 14.27)

Divine Experience.quote: When one sees Me in all beings and sees all beings in Me, I never leave him and he never leaves Me. (Bhagavad Gita 6.30)

Divine Path.quote: Fix your mind upon Me, become My devotee, worship Me, offer your homage unto Me, and you shall certainly come to Me. (Bhagavad Gita 18.65)

Divine Liberation.quote: One who knows the transcendental nature of My appearance and activities does not, upon leaving the body, take birth again. (Bhagavad Gita 4.9)

Divine Universe.quote: This entire cosmic manifestation is pervaded by Me in My unmanifest form. (Bhagavad Gita 9.4)
